title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 8189.5 - Scale
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 8189.5 - Scale

State Regulations

Cities and villages shall be mapped at a scale no smaller
than one inch equals 100 feet. Densely populated areas shall be mapped at one
inch equals 50 feet. Other areas shall be mapped at one inch equals 200 feet or
one inch equals 400 feet, whichever is appropriate for the area being mapped. The map scale shall be such that when parcels are delineated on the map there
shall be, within each parcel, adequate room to contain the lot number and the
parcel dimensions. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
ยง
8189.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
